statement.p: Convert the measurement. You may find it useful to use this table.

solution.p: This can be converted using the unit conversion ratios: 1 pint/2 cups, quart/2 pints, and 1 gallon/4 quarts. Multiply these so that all the units divide out except for gallons.

\displaystyle{48}\ \text{ cups}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ \text{ pint}}}{{{2}\ \text{ cups}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ \text{ quart}}}{{{2}\ \text{ pints}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ \text{ gallon}}}{{{4}\ \text{ quarts}}}=\frac{{48}}{{16}}\text{gallons}={3}\ \text{ gallons}.
